trans-unit.source: How to debug SAML-based single sign-on to applications in Azure Active Directory | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to debug SAML-based single sign-on to applications in Azure Active Directory | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to debug SAML-based single sign-on to applications in Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Learn how to debug SAML-based single sign-on to applications in Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: How to debug SAML-based single sign-on to applications in Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: How to debug SAML-based single sign-on to applications in Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: When debugging a SAML-based application integration, it is often helpful to use a tool like [Fiddler](http://www.telerik.com/fiddler) to see the SAML request, the SAML response, and the actual SAML token that is issued to the application.
trans-unit.target: When debugging a SAML-based application integration, it is often helpful to use a tool like [Fiddler](http://www.telerik.com/fiddler) to see the SAML request, the SAML response, and the actual SAML token that is issued to the application.

trans-unit.source: By examining the SAML token, you can ensure that all of the required attributes, the username in the SAML subject, and the issuer URI are coming through as expected.
trans-unit.target: By examining the SAML token, you can ensure that all of the required attributes, the username in the SAML subject, and the issuer URI are coming through as expected.

trans-unit.source: The response from Azure AD that contains the SAML token is typically the one that occurs after an HTTP 302 redirect from https://login.windows.net, and is sent to the configured **Reply URL** of the application.
trans-unit.target: The response from Azure AD that contains the SAML token is typically the one that occurs after an HTTP 302 redirect from https://login.windows.net, and is sent to the configured **Reply URL** of the application.

trans-unit.source: You can view the SAML token by selecting this line and then selecting the **Inspectors > WebForms** tab in the right panel.
trans-unit.target: You can view the SAML token by selecting this line and then selecting the **Inspectors > WebForms** tab in the right panel.

trans-unit.source: From there, right-click the **SAMLResponse** value and select **Send to TextWizard**.
trans-unit.target: From there, right-click the **SAMLResponse** value and select **Send to TextWizard**.

trans-unit.source: Then select **From Base64** from the **Transform** menu to decode the token and see its contents.
trans-unit.target: Then select **From Base64** from the **Transform** menu to decode the token and see its contents.

trans-unit.source: **Note**: To see the contents of this HTTP request, Fiddler may prompt you to configure decryption of HTTPS traffic, which you will need to do.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: To see the contents of this HTTP request, Fiddler may prompt you to configure decryption of HTTPS traffic, which you will need to do.
